alert.note: Alert for Arthur; Eastern Cherry; Grant; Hooker; Keith; Lincoln; McPherson; Thomas; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 18 at 9:30PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Arthur, central Cherry, eastern Grant, northeastern Keith, Hooker, northwestern Lincoln, McPherson and western Thomas Counties through 1015 PM CDT/915 PM MDT/... At 929 PM CDT/829 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles west of Cody to 17 miles south of Medicine Lake to 6 miles southwest of Whitman to 11 miles southwest of Arthur. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Cody around 835 PM MDT. Nenzel around 845 PM MDT. Kilgore around 855 PM MDT. Mullen around 905 PM MDT. Valentine, Seneca and Valentine National Wildlife Refuge around 1015 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Speckel Meir Lake, Eli, Duluth, Flatts, Cogill Lake, Cody Lake, Marsh Flat, Anderson Bridge State Wildlife Management Area, Green Lake and Bucktail Lake. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 148 and 206. Highway 2 between mile markers 151 and 205. Highway 61 between mile markers 108 and 144. Highway 92 between mile markers 165 and 207. Highway 97 between mile markers 32 and 141. Highway 83 between mile markers 170 and 222. Highway 12 between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Arthur; Eastern Cherry; Grant; Hooker; Keith; Lincoln; McPherson; Thomas; Western Cherry
